discussion.content:
All seem correct EXCEPT A. A is definite. E is the low confidence answer.

"runtime decisions" seems to be the key but not confident in which of the 3. B & E are the confusion. E. does not seem to have a user-defined runtime condition capabilties.

https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/saas/supply-chain-management/20c/faiom/orchestrate-fulfillment.html#FAIOM211469

questions.question_text: Which three attributes in the orchestration process definition utilize Oracle business rules to make runtime decisions for process behavior? (Choose three.)

choices.F: You can enable a checkout option for a model when a valid configuration is finalized.
choices.C: You can create rules that will guide users in creating a valid model.
choices.E: You can test the behavior of the configured model anytime when you are editing it.
choices.D: You can create user interfaces that will be dynamically presented to users based on the options chosen in the Configurator model.
choices.G: You can display product reviews of customers who have purchased the same configuration earlier.
choices.A: You can allow buyers to raise requests if an expected product functionality is not offered.
choices.B: You can create enhancements to the model structure that supplements the imported configurable structure of a model item.

questions.question_text:
A global Power Systems manufacturer sells Uninterrupted Power Supply (UPS) products through its online portal. To gain competitive advantage, the manufacturer wants to enhance the ability of buyers to select a desired configuration of the high-end UPS models through guided selling options on its online selling portal. The companys product development team has finalized the enhancements, and needs your help to get them implemented on their online selling portal that is supported by Oracle Cloud Configurator.
What four actions would you take in Oracle Cloud Configurator to enhance a buyers experience? (Choose four.)

discussion.content:
B. You can create enhancements to the model structure that supplements the imported configurable structure of a model item.
C. You can create rules that will guide users in creating a valid model.
D. You can create user interfaces that will be dynamically presented to users based on the options chosen in the Configurator model.
E. You can test the behavior of the configured model anytime when you are editing it.

B & D.

You can define an assignment rule that assigns an orchestration process to one or more fulfillment lines of a sales order. (https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/saas/supply-chain-management/r13-update17d/faiom/scm-cloud-implementing-order-management.pdf )

choices.A: when you require multiple orchestration processes for one fulfillment line
choices.B: when you require one orchestration process for one fulfillment line
choices.D: when you require one orchestration process for multiple fulfillment lines
choices.C: when you require one orchestration process for sales order lines

questions.question_text: Identify two valid use cases where a process assignment rule is defined to assign an orchestration process. (Choose two.)

Your customer wants to prohibit updates to the "Subcontractor License No" field in a fulfillment line after a fulfillment line is closed. The "Subcontractor License No" field is a context-based extensible flexfield in the fulfillment line.
Identify the correct sequence of steps for setting up the preceding constraint.

discussion.content: D. Enable the extensible flexfield > Create a validation rule set > Create the processing constraint.

choices.D: Enable the extensible flexfield > Create a validation rule set > Create the processing constraint.
choices.E: Create a constraint entity > Enable the extensible flexfield > Create a record set > Create a validation rule set > Create a processing constraint.
choices.C: Enable the extensible flexfield > Create a record set > Create a validation rule set > Create the processing constraint.
choices.A: Create a constraint entity > Enable the extensible flexfield > Create a validation rule set > Create a record set > Create a processing constraint.
choices.B: Enable the extensible flexfield > Create a validation rule set > Create a record set > Create the processing constraint.

discussion.content: A. All order capture and fulfillment systems are defined as Spoke systems.

choices.A: All order capture and fulfillment systems are defined as Spoke systems.
choices.B: The Oracle Fusion order capture and fulfillment system is defined as Fusion.
choices.C: All external order capture systems are defined as Spoke systems and the Fusion fulfillment system is defined as Fusion.
choices.D: All external order capture systems are defined as Spoke systems and external fulfillment systems are defined as purchased.

questions.question_text: Which statement is true about the definition of source systems in Functional Setup manager?
